reviews.text: We stayed for just one night on the way back from a drive through Italy and Switzerland. As before the staff were very good and service excellent. The food was a little down on quality than before. The rooms were very good and although the area has been developed more there were no noise issues. TV and wifi very good and the rooms were clean and serviceable. A good stop-off point for any long distance traveller.
reviews.title: Another good stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Looked nice on web page, but not in reality. We had a ground floor room enroute from Italy. It was a hot day & there was no Air Con. Full size windows had no security so had to be kept shut. Bath/Shower old and rusty with tap that moves around. Lights kept turning themselves off. when female receptionist came to investigate she got shock from fittings. Room was so small bathroom door would not close as beds in the way. The only saving grace was bed was comfortable and clean. Manager on leaving was not interested and shrugged his sholders. Hotel not easy to find as webpage inaccurate.
reviews.title: Never again

reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights and I liked it. There is parking and a restaurant, but we didn't eat there except for breakfast, which was a pretty nice spread. There is an electric kettle in our room and some coffee and tea. Wi-fi was strong and never gave up. Staff was friendly and understood english. Comfortable, but small twin room was good enough for two people(if you are looking to hang out in a hotel room, this would not be the one). The grounds were very clean, there were even landscapers putting plants into the planter boxes in the windows, a great touch. I would recommend to anyone!
reviews.title: Pretty darn nice!

reviews.text: I used this hotel for one night on the way from Brussels to the Alsace area of France. It would be impossible to get to this place without a car, as it's in the middle of nowhere. That said, there were a couple of fast-food places to eat just nearby. However my friends and I decided to drive into the center of Metz, which was about a 15-minute trip.
reviews.title: OK hotel as a 1-night stop-over

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The receptionist of the hotel was pretty friendly and helpful, giving us a map of Metz and some advice. The room was OK and even had a coffee pot. A room with twin beds cost 62 euro. Breakfast was 8 euro extra, per person. Although it was nothing special, the room was clean and comfortable enough to have a good night's sleep. And the hotel was quiet. So it wasn't too bad, after all.
reviews.title: OVERNIGHT STAY
